documents.document: My satisfaction comes from my commitment to advancing a better world. -Faye Wattleton
"Whatever you vividly imagine, ardently desire, sincerely believe and enthusiastically act upon...must inevitably come to pass." -Paul Meyer
You can change all things for the better when you change yourself for the better. -Jim Rohn
Most of the shadows of this life are caused by standing in one's own sunshine. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul? -John Keats
I start where the last man left off. -Thomas Edison
The formula for success is simple: practice and concentration then more practice and more concentration. -Babe Zaharias
The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. -Cecil B. De Mille
The key to any game is to use your strengths and hide your weaknesses. -Paul Westphal
We are made strong by the difficulties we face, not by those we evade. -Unknown
The greatest evil which fortune can inflict on men is to endow them with small talents and great ambitions. -M. De Vauvenargues
What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight; it's the size of the fight in the dog. -Dwight D. Eisenhower
Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence. -Sydney Smith
Keep your eyes wide open before marriage, and half-shut afterwards. - Benjamin Franklin
Success is the good fortune that comes from aspiration, desperation, perspiration and inspiration. -Jospeph Addison
Make voyages! Attempt them! There's nothing else. -Tennessee Williams
Persist and persevere, and you will find most things that are attainable, possible. -Philip Dormer Stanhope Chesterfield
There is no impossibility to him who stands prepared to conquer every hazard. The fearful are the failing. -Sarah J. Hale
Discontent is something that follows ambition like a shadow. -Henry H. Haskins
Oh man! There is no planet, sun or star that could hold you, if you but knew what you are. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
Immense power is acquired by assuring yourself in your secret reveries that you were born to control affairs. -Andrew Carnegie
Success is 99% failure. -Soichiro Honda
You don't become enormously successful without encountering and overcoming a number of extremely challenging problems. - Mark Victor Hansen
Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed -- there's so little competition. - Elbert Hubbard
Nothing can resist the human will that will stake even its existence on its stated purpose. -Benjamin Disraeli
It is wise to keep in mind that no success or failure is necessarily final. -Unknown
If you want to make enemies, try to change something. -Woodrow Wilson
Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much. - Oscar Wilde
A "No" uttered from deepest conviction is better & greater than a "Yes" merely uttered to please, or worse, to avoid trouble. -Gandhi
It is better to be prepared for an opportunity and not have one than to have an opportunity and not be prepared. -Whitney Young Jr.
Live out of your imagination, not your history. - Stephen Covey
"Too much of a good thing can be wonderful." -Mae West
A learned blockhead is a greater blockhead than an ignorant one. -Benjamin Franklin
It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations. -Winston Churchill
One knows one's weak points so well, that it's rather bewildering to have critics overlook them & invent others. -E Wharton
Something that we think is impossible now will not be impossible in another decade. -Constance Baker Motley
Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen. -Michael Jordan
Share the passion and action of your time, at peril of being judged not to have lived. -Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr
We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish. -Anthony Robbins
Everything I know I learned after I was thirty. - Georges Clemenceau
The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have. -Norman Vincent Peale
Hope is the companion of power, and mother of success; for who so hopes strongly has within him the gift of miracles. -Samuel Smiles
"Nothing relieves and ventilates the mind like a resolution." -John Burroughs
Cheerfulness and contentment are great beautifiers and are famous preservers of youthful looks. - Charles Dickens
Never cut what can be untied. -Portuguese Proverb
The basis of accomplishment is in never quitting. -Mengzi Meng-tse
Let your hook always be cast. In the pool where you least expect it, will be a fish. - Ovid
Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body. It is wholesome & bracing for the mind to have its faculties kept on the stretch. -R Steele

Success isn't magic or hocus-pocus -- its simply learning how to focus.
Jack Canfield
#quotes… https://t.co/ryJYR9SFYB
When you discover your mission...it will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it. -W. Clement Stone
Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other. Walter Elliot
People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
If you have the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed. -David Viscott
It is a rarity to find someone who can weigh other people's faults without putting his own thumbs on the scale. -Paraguayan Proverb

To guarantee success, act as if it were impossible to fail. -Dorothea Brande
#quotes #sayings… https://t.co/57hRfELv5m
He that is discontented in one place will seldom be content in another. - Aesop
Nothing is so embarrassing as watching someone do something that you said couldn't be done. -Sam Ewing
Problems cannot be solved at the same level of awareness that created them. - Albert Einstein

The first and most important step toward success is the feeling that we can succeed.
Nelson… https://t.co/ocDSTL5O3W
Live and work but do not forget to play, to have fun in life and really enjoy it. - Eileen Caddy
It is a fine thing to have ability, but the ability to discover ability in others is the true test. -Elbert Hubbard
A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stop. -Henry Brooks Adams
Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed. - Benjamin Franklin
When you reach for the stars, you may not quite get one, but you won't come up with a handful of mud either. -Leo Burnett
Opportunity is a moving target, and the bigger the opportunity, the faster it moves. -Richard Gaylord Briley
We learn wisdom from failure much more than success. We often discover what we will do, by finding out what we will not do. -Samuel Smiles
We need the courage to start and continue what we should do, and courage to stop what we shouldn't do. -Richard L. Evans
My father taught me that the only way you can make good at anything is to practice, and then practice some more. -Pete Rose
What do we live for if not to make the world less difficult for each other? -George Eliot
Don't talk about yourself; it will be done when you leave. -Wilson Mizner
Our minds can shape the way a thing will be because we act according to our expectations. -Federico Fellini
"No thoroughly occupied man was ever yet very miserable." -L.E. Landon
The hopeful man sees success where others see failure, sunshine where others see shadows and storm. -Orison Swett Marden
Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time. -Thomas Edison

Anyone notice that my design abilities are better? 🤣😅
Here's the text of the quote:
To… https://t.co/p42B3DJjEO
Be awfully nice to them going up, because you're gonna meet them all coming down. -Jimmy Durante
Take the course opposite to custom and you will almost always do well. -Jean Jacques Rousseau
The safest principle through life, instead of reforming others, is to set about perfecting yourself. -B.R. Haydon
Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of. -Benjamin Franklin
You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims. -Harriet Woods
If you want to be incrementally better: Be competitive. If you want to be exponentially better: Be cooperative. -Unknown
"I can accept failure, but I can't accept not trying.â€ - Michael Jordan
There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen. -Wayne Dyer
I've always believed that you can think positive just as well as you can think negative. -Sugar Ray Robinson

If you have something to do that is worthwhile doing, don't talk about it...do it.
-George W.… https://t.co/rOkJuTqNml
We know too much & feel too little. At least, we feel too little of those creative emotions from which a good life springs. -B Russell
We are here to enrich the world, and we impoverish ourselves if we forget this errand. -Woodrow T. Wilson
The significance of a man is not in what he attains, but rather what he longs to attain. -Kahlil Gibran
If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment. - Henry David Thoreau
You get the best out of others when you get the best out of yourself. -Harvey S. Firestone
You cannot be anything if you want to be everything. -Solomon Schechter
Acquire new knowledge whilst thinking over the old, and you may become a teacher of others. - Confucius
To dare is to lose one's footing momentarily. To not dare is to lose oneself. -Soren Kierkegaard
Crises refine life. In them you discover what you are. -Allan K. Chalmers
To eat an egg, you must break the shell. -Jamaican Proverb
If you think education is expensive, try ignorance. -Derek Bok
We can't afford to waste tears on might-have-beens. We need to turn the tears into sweat that can take us to what can be. -Waitley
Jumping at several small opportunities may get us there more quickly than waiting for one big one to come along. -Hugh Allen
If you have knowledge, let others light their candles with it. - Winston Churchill
If you train hard, you'll not only be hard, you'll be hard to beat. -Herschel Walker
